description: "Pang" is an onimatopoeia that discribes the brutal forces unleashed from the very first bar. The stream of energy contiunes throughout the piece. The piece was comissioned by Bispehaugen Ungdomskorps (Bispehaugen Concert Band) in 1998. A version for brass band was written for Manger Musikklag and recorded by them on "Grafitti", Bjørn Sagstad conducting.

titre: Ain't That A Kick In The Head

sous_titre: Concert Band, Piano and Metal Percussion - Complete Set

description: This gorgeous arrangement of the tender ballad about the love shared between best friends from the hit musical, Wicked, will be the perfect showcase of your young band's tone, phrasing and musicianship. Masterfully scored to be either a standalone arrangement or as an accompaniment to the vocal arrangement by Mac Huff (HL#08621340). Perfect for any concert program.

This showstopper from the movie Wonka is sure to be a crowd-pleaser! This terrific arrangement has many teachable moments, including swinging eighth notes, dynamic shifts, rhythmic interplay, independence, and more. Full of energy and excitement, this expertly scored arrangement of You've Never Had Chocolate Like This by Michael Story is the perfect choice for your next concert.
titre: You've Never Had Chocolate Like This

description: This gorgeous arrangement of the tender ballad about the love shared between best friends from the hit musical, Wicked, will be the perfect showcase of your young band's tone, phrasing and musicianship. Masterfully scored to be either a standalone arrangement or as an accompaniment to the vocal arrangement by Mac Huff (HL#08621340). Perfect for any concert program.

As the title implies, this short yet dynamic work is intended as a fast-paced burner and quite possibly positioned at the front of any concert program. Filled with dynamic twists and turns, along with cascading woodwind passages and splashes of brass and percussion, there is a sense of almost being out of control as it reaches an exciting and dramatic finish. Dur: ca. 3:00 (Recorded live by the Eastman Wind Ensemble

La divine muse de la musique n'a pas pu être célébrée par le rassemblement pendant la pandémie de Covid. Il est d’autant plus important, aujourd’hui, de se réjouir de pouvoir jouer ensemble comme avant, de retour dans les bras de la muse. Cette œuvre exprime des émotions variées : la vulnérabilité, le désespoir, mais surtout l'espoir, l'euphorie et la gratitude, alors que muse, musique et musiciens s'unissent à

Les Jeux Olympiques de 2024 se déroulant à Paris, la Confédération Musicale de France a souhaité y prendre part en commandant une œuvre qui rassemblerait les musiciens autour de l’événement sportif. Le compositeur Thierry Deleruyelle a écrit une œuvre festive et dynamique dont l’instrumentation flexible à dix parties convient à n’importe quelle formation : orchestre d’harmonie ou fanfare. Si l'on devait résumer

La musique touche l'âme humaine. C'est à partir de cette idée simple et pourtant si vaste que Jacob de Haan a créé son  Hymnus Animae  (Hymne de l'âme). Une œuvre lente et émouvante, écrite par le compositeur pour toucher musiciens et auditeurs : un joyau musical qui mérite vraiment une scène pour briller.
